subject: Re: [junit] setup XMLUnit
msgSnippet: Thanks anyway, James. I m mainly puzzled, too, by the fact that one method can be resolved but not the other. If I type XMLUnit. in the IDE, the method lists
messageBody:
Thanks anyway, James. I'm mainly puzzled, too, by the fact that one method can
be resolved but not the other. If I type "XMLUnit." in the IDE, the method
lists has "setControlParser()" and "setTestParser()" but not
"setSAXParserFactory()" or "setTransformerFactory()".

-Jing


--- James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:

> On 18/10/05, Jing Chen <chen_jingjing@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hi James,
> >
> > Thanks for replying. This is an IDE problem - I'm using JBuilder. I have
> > added
> > libraries for all those jar files.
> >
> > Are these two in seperate jars: assertXMLEqual() and assertXpathExists(),
> > because I only have problem with the latter? If yes, which jar file should
> > I
> > add?
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > -Jing
>
>
> I'm too young to have used JBuilder in any form - only Eclipse, Netbeans and
> IDEA! So I'm not best placed to give you specific help with configuring that
> IDE.
>
> Both those methods are part of the XMLTestCase that is part of xmlunit. I'm
> very surprised that you can resolve one but not the other. Can you browse
> that object in your IDE and check the methods listed?
>
> A few other options spring to mind:
>
> 1. Use ANT or similar to build it - probably the easiest approach.
> 2. Presumably JBuilder provides some form of capturing the command
> used to try to compile?
> 3. Build it on the command-line.
>
> James
>
> --- James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
> >
> > > On 17/10/05, chen_jingjing <chen_jingjing@...> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Hi,
> > > >
> > > > I'm learning about XMLUnit. When I tried with the sample code from
> > > > http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/example.html, I can't get rid of the
> > > > following compile error:
> > > >
> > > > cannot find symbol; symbol : method assertXpathExists
> > > > (java.lang.String,java.lang.String), location: class
> > > > XMLFileExporterTest at line 47 (47:9)
> > > >
> > > > Among all the assert functions, I only have trouble with Xpath
> > > > related ones.
> > > >
> > > > When I tried to configure the parsers, I had "connot find symbol"
> > > > error for XMLUnit.setSAXParserFactory() and
> > > > XMLUnit.setTransformerFactory().
> > > >
> > > > I have included the following jars: xmlunit1.0, xalan, xml-apis,
> > > > serializer, xercesImpl.
> > > >
> > > > Any suggestions would be appreciated! If there's a FAQ for XMLUnit
> > > > somewhere, I'd be happy to check it out as well.
> > > >
> > > > Thanks.
> > > > -Jing
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >

> > > >
> > > Jing,
> > >
> > > It does sound like a classpath issue. Can you provide a command-line
> > that
> > > you're using, or is this an IDE problem?
> > >
> > > James
